reviewText:
Sniper Elite 3 (SE3) takes place in Northern Africa, which is a theatre often neglected in WWII games. Usually games focus on the European Theatre (western and/or eastern fronts) and slightly less often, the Pacific Theatre. That's a nice change and presents a locale that hasn't been overused.

Something I also like about North Africa is that despite it being mostly a rocky desert, there is still plenty of environmental plant life to make the scenary appear not quite as depressing. I remember in Sniper Elite v2 (SEv2) thinking that the constant use of broken and blasted buildings became quite tiring, despite it being accurate for the location.

SE3 brings in slight RPG aspects, in that your equipment has various stats. The rifles in particular are interesting because you can greatly modify them using parts you find as you play. That said, many of the better" rifles and pistols are only available in DLC packages
date: but it's entirely possible to play through the whole game and do exceptionally well without ever spending a dime on any DLC.\n\nThe overall game mechanics are similar to SEv2. On easier difficutly levels you don't have to account for gravity (bullet drop) or wind
recommended: and pressing the focus button (the default is "E") enhances your zoom and slows down time. You have a limited amount of focus and if you expend it before firing
hoursPlayed: you'll zoom out and time will resume as normal. Fortunately
voteText: focus replenishes by itself.\n\nHead shots are preferable to body shots
helpfulPercent: although I've managed to kill enemies after hitting them in the leg. You can perforate major blood vessels and organs (seen through an x-ray view when hitting the enemy)
votesHelpful: which the game acknowledges
votesTotal: but I don't know if that really makes a difference as far as killing them goes. I believe the game really just takes into account general location damage
votesFunny: so a high velocity shot to the abdomen might result in a kill
commentsCount: regardless of it tearing apart the intestines or kidneys.\n\nRemaining undetected is a major part of SE3. You can do this by using your sidearm (assuming you've taken either the Welrod or the HDM
column16: both of which have suppressors attached to them)
column17: stabbing an unsuspecting enemy in the back
column18: or using noise to hide your sniper shots. Noise cover can range from artillery fire to PA announcements to sabotaging a generator.\n\nAlthough you have a secondary weapon (which can be anything from a Thompson submachine gun to a Panzerschrek
column19: which is essentially a rocket launcher)
column20: using it will undoubtedly cause a ton of noise
column21: thereby attracting scores of enemy soldiers who will overwhelm you on anything except the lowest difficultly level. Even then
column22: it's still fairly easy to die
column23: so it's best to avoid that scenario entirely if at all possible.\n\nUnlike SEv2
column24: enemies DO NOT suddenly pop up out of nowhere. Reinforcements can be called in (usually through scripted events)
column25: but you won't have to deal with inching forward after clearing an area only to come upon a soldier who materialized out of thin air.\n\nThe campaign takes place over eight long missions. In contrast to SEv2
column26: which relied entirely on checkpoints
column27: SE3 allows you to save whenever and wherever you wish using manual saves and quicksaves. Some players might find this "cheap" or refer to it as "save scumming
column28:
but to me it's simply a matter of convenience, which lets me play for as long or as little as I choose.

Multiplayer takes the form of PvP and PvE Co-op. In PvP multiplayer, you play on a team and fight other players, whereas in PvE Co-op, its you and your teammate against the AI.

In co-op, you have three choices:
1. Play through the entire campaign in co-op mode.
2. Play specific downloaded missions.
3. Play unique asymetric assignments, where one player has a sniper rifle and a pistol, and the other player has a pistol, secondary weapon (such as an MP-40), and binoculars.

A shooting range has also been added as an extra single player mode, which lets you practice with all the weapons, including explosives.

No matter how good SE3 is, there are some problems.

When playing co-op, the campaign missions only use temporary checkpoint saves (as opposed to the save anywhere" method in single player)
column29: which can make for some exceptionally long game times. These checkpoints only last for the duration of the session
column31: you'll have to start over the beginning of the mission.\n\nThis has been a problem for my wife and me
column33: we don't always feel like spending four hours or so on one mission. It would be nice if the game at least saved the progress of the mission on the host's machine and allowed the players to continue where they left off.\n\nThe asymetric missions almost always include a "horde mode" component
column34: where you have to defend against waves upon waves of enemies. In a game like SE3
column35: where stealth and not being noticed is generally considered important
column36: this seems very out-of-place and if you're not ready for it
column37: quite jarring as well.\n\nSomething else that's of general annoyance is the way a weapon's stats are presented. Using a combination of white
column39: and red bars to denote standard
column41: and reduced stats (when comparing other weapons to your currently armed weapon)
column42: understanding the bars can be unclear
column43: at least at first. I would've preferred numbers instead of nondescript bars
column44: but it's not a big deal overall.\n\nIn the end
column45: would I recommend Sniper Elite 3? Absolutely. If you're the least bit interested in playing a sniper and World War II
column46: there's no reason for me to not recommend this game."

reviewText:
I've played a lot of, and beaten many times, Sniper Elite v2 on my Xbox 360. That was an excelent game, 10/10. However, this installment in the series is just garbage.

Firstly, the amount of glitches and bugs present is ridiculous. For a polished game, especially after the non-glitched Sniper Elite v2, there are too many bugs (and very serious ones too) and don't seem like they are ever going to be fixed by the devs. Ex: I was mid-bullet cam (a quarter of the way through my first mission) and my game crashed, I had to quit it and restart the game. Another serious bug is when I beat the first mission only to proceed to the main menu and it saying that I haven't beat the first mission and I must restart it.

Aside from the bugs and glitches, it is basically like Sniper Elite v2 but in a different environment, oh and I should mention that the environment is WAY TOO BRIGHT. Even if you turn down the gamma, the reflection of the world and brightness of the terrain is blinding, that is not realistic and extremely annoying after a while.

There are, essentially, the same amount of guns, slightly more equipment; and the sound effects of weapons, germans, and the environment, are exactly the same. You can customize" your rifle...but changing the reticle and material of the scope is not full customization.

Also
date: long range sniping (like the second game) is barely present. The game is mostly close-quarters so you don't have much breathing room to stop and make a shot at a far distanced enemy. Snipers are meant to fire from long distances
recommended: not 5 feet away from the enemy.\n\nOn the pleasent side
hoursPlayed: the multiplayer experience is fun
voteText: and the survival mode is alright. The bullet cam hasn't changed too much but it is still exciting to watch a bullet rip through a German soldier's nutsack. There is bountiful amount of enemies in a mission so you can just keep picking off those damn Nazi soldiers until you have had your killing fix. I can't think of any more good qualities of the game.\n\nSo with everything (or what I can think of) said
helpfulPercent:
I unfortunatelly cannot recommend Sniper Elite 3. I paid $21 on sale (for the game+season pass) which I regret. I'm trying to save you from spending your money on this let-down failure of a game. You can watch videos and read other reviews and I gaurentee you that most of them are negative towards this game.

Rating? 5/10

Note: My edits (or updates) were just grammar corrections."

reviewText:
It's exceptionally well made, great graphics and gameplay.

Pros
- Multiplayer is sniping paradise, tons of servers and a cool community
- You can stealth through the whole game.
- Gigantic well thought out maps, beautiful details
- Historical detailed environment - enemies speak Italian, German, etc.
- Optimized, beautiful graphics and high frame rates
- Generally a very pleasant improvement on the previous release.

Cons
- More weapons I guess?  Not really a con for me, especially with the ability to customize them completely, even with reticles.
- Hilarious ragdoll physics, anyone who has played knows.  While it's very amusing, not always realistic to shoot someone in the foot and then they do a flip in the air.

reviewText:
EDIT (22.07.2014): Raw mouse input is now available, but the game remains... kinda ♥♥♥♥♥♥.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Negative mouse acceleration, wonky alt+tab where it often bugs out, constantly throws you out when you want to tab back into the game, no option to go for windowed mode, very poor npc and character animations that don't really make it fun to follow an NPC with your scope... they just sometimes suddenly stop and turn around without a fluid animation, it is literally just 'teleporting' into different animations, if there is a transition between stances for npcs it's like 1 frame or non-existent.

sometimes there's a delay to you clicking and your character actually firing, poorly responsive controls at best.

multiplayer is an absolute mess, unplayable.
No matter what mode it is, it is a pure camp fest, nonstop, all the time. You move around, you die; you camp in one spot, maybe switch spots after 2-3 kills, you win, no mechanics that give people an incentive to actually move, so can't blame the players. Can't wait for one person to comment well it is a sniper game

reviewText: I LOVE THE GRAPHICS. Don't get me wrong when I say I don't recommend this game. It's just that it's not fun anymore when you see that much blood and gore in a headshot. Once, a dude's head literally exploded from one bullet I inserted into his skull. That's just too much for me. If you ask me, Sniper Elite V2 was a WHOLE lot better in toning down the gore. When you get a pristine headshot, the guy actually looks like a model in one of those medical books with the veins, bones, and everything! That not only crosses the line, but completely destroys it into the Uncanny Valley. It's SO deep in the Uncanny Valley, it would make the Kola Superdeep Borehole look like a pinhole.

reviewText:
Sniper Elite 3 has provided several new aspects to the Sniper Elite trilogy, making it an excellent sequel, including features such as...

- A new sandbox" type  feel to the game that its predecessors had lacked.
- A change of scenery from the typical WW2 shooters taking place in Europe and the Pacific.
- A clever (yet primitive) relocation system after every shot.
- An awesome class customization system.
- Missions that can take up to 2 hours to complete if you attempt to do everything in the game you can.
- The multiplayer is still very entertaining
date: but I would like to warn potential buyers that there are usually only around 13 servers capable of holding 12 players each in session.\n\nThe Sniper Elite series i have come to enjoy greatly
recommended: and SE3 has and continues to provide me with numerous hours of enjoyment
hoursPlayed: however I simply CAN NOT RECOMMEND  Sniper Elite 3 simply because I am extremely disappointed that the game WAS RELEASED ALONGSIDE $25 WORTH OF DOWNLOADABLE CONTENT. Although the content is basically only aesthetic (in my opinion
voteText:
the DLC weapons provide little change in gameplay) it still makes me furious. This is content that could have been included into standalone game!


TL;DR - Sniper Elite 3 is an excellent sequel to Sniper Elite V2 and provides several new features that make the game more enjoyable than the last
helpfulPercent: HOWEVER I CAN NOT AND WILL NOT RECOMMEND IT simply to reflect my disappointment that the game was realeased with $25 worth of downloadable content. Beware that there are only roughly 100 people playing multiplayer at a time."

reviewText: How Rebellion can charge £40 for this is beyond me. The game is neither finished nor polished. I have experienced xray bullet cams simply not showing up, although the sound does play. Objects such as ammo caches being present but not visible (still usable though). Grey aiming indicator suggesting that there is an obstruction between me and my target when there clearly is not. Invisible walls. Clunky movement in 3rd person. Graphics dont load as quickly as they should when you change from looking at something far away to something much closer (see wolfenstein the new order). A dreadfully small selection of weapons and maps (roughly 4 snipers, 4 side arms and about 6 MP maps). Dont even get me started on the fact that you have to buy DLC to add more weapons. The campaign is a bit short in my opinion. They have completely overdone the xray bullet cams. Almost every single kill you make with a sniper activates it, it is difficult to build up any momentum in the SP when literally every time you shoot somebody you have to endure 3 - 5 second slow mo animation of your kill.\n\nOn the bright side though, you can shoot peoples testicles off.

reviewText:
While this game has all the fun mechanics as the 2nd game, and imprived slow motion cameras (with xray), I cannot recommend this game to anyone. Its entirely too short.  A complete playthrough was under 4 hours, and that was with a bit of fooling around.

Multiplayer? Really? A shooter focusing entirely on sniping? Sniping is usually what most online shooters try to minimize, not focus 100% on. Its no wonder there are only about 5 games with players during prime time.

Dont waste your money on this game, unless you can get it for like 5 bucks. Thats about as much entertainment as it will give you.
voteText: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Con:
- Poor control due to bad 3rd person implementation. A scrolling option like in Skyrim would be good. It is extremely hard to maneuver inside a building or between cover-sandbags. And you can barely estimate if your choosen cover will hide you from getting spotted.
- When you aim 1st person you will likely hit an obstructing object (door frame, window).
- There is no such thing as tactics because you can not always choose your path. No free movement.
- 99% of the fights take place in almost cqb (50m). That is not sniping!
- DCLs (= Did not finish game / want more money). But that is a common probleme these days.

Pro:
- Nice graphics and lighting
- Runnes smooth on GTX770

Maybe the developer should not have focused on Revamped human X-Ray Kill cam". Was good in SE2 anyway."

reviewText:
Welrod Elite...

It is a definitley fun game; yet, as the game goes on you start to realize using a sniper rifle is more dangerous. So you start using welrod more than sniper rifles. (especially on elite difficulty)

In the end, this game should be called, Welrod Elite, rather than sniper elite. Cause about 90% of your kills will come from Welrod pistol.

Also I just played coop with my friend. It is fun, but the game itself was so buggy that sometimes we had to reload our last check point save to solve that problem. It is so buggy that my friend and I actually came to a point that this game was not in stage for selling.

There still needs to be a lot done in this game. The reason why the game is disappointing is that probably the game does not worth 49.99$. With fix of bunch of bugs, more maps, wide variety of weapons, and more places to mask your shots, people will enjoy Sniper elite 3.

It is an ambitious game and it did satisfy me and my friend in some degree;yet, still a lot of things need to be done.

reviewText:
I regret buying this game even on sale. The whole X-ray cam on snipe hit is awesome, but it gets old fast.  The rest of the game is like an advanced version of whack a mole. Enemy pops up, shoot, move to next position, repeat untill next objective, do that for the next couple hours and the game is over.

Enemies patrol faster then you can really set up a viable trap, if you try to trigger them to go through it by alarming them they rarely go very far from their patrol pattern so your lucky if you can get a kill that way. If you play on hardest difficulty, you will find it isn't a challenge, but more of a guessing game where your bullets will go, as the game gives no clue where the drift will be, a guess to how far the enemy is, and finding where a missed bullet even went can be tricky.

On top of all this, the game is designed focusing on stealth and tactics, but you will find there is not only no motivation in a lot of parts to be stealthy, it is actually easier just to run in guns blazing, and there is no reprecussions to that as the game has absolutely no reward for being stealthy, other then to add hours onto game play of watching your guy crawl through areas of the map.

reviewText:
Simply, this is not a snipping game anymore!!! You rarely have to use your sniper, and the game does not reward you at all for snipping!!! You are encouraged to sneak, do stealth kills, and use your silenced pistole!!!
If you fire sniper once, you have to retreat couple of meters until bar empties. and if you fire your sniper 2 times, then hae to retreat a bit more to make enemies go to their postions again!!! And the game keeps going like this to the end!!
AI is so dumb, it does not matter what diffic setting you choose, each enemy moves in the same dirction back and forth!!!
Most of the time you have to walk ducked down, becz the character will run without you using key or button, and enemies will hear you.
No bosses fights, and no challenging events. It is purely a cheap stealth game that does not encourage anything new or tries to push you to think!!!
Still worth playing for 10$ but not for a full price or even half-price

I would not recommend this game for less than 5 euro and only to people who really like stealth game. I was hoping for a great sniper game, but this was just really boring and tedious.

voteText: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
I really wanted to like this game.  I played V2 through 3 times on the PS3, bought the zombies army 2 game for PC and played through solo and with a buddy, all of which was fun fun fun.

Sadly, this new incarnation is a real let down for me.  It just feels so lazily thrown together, it's lacking any atmosphere, there's no tension at all and it's SO SO SO very easy.  Even on the hardest settings it's a piece of ♥♥♥♥, and offers little to no satisfaction for any effort you put in.

A highly uninspiring game that feels like Rebellion just copped out and cashed in on the popularity of previous titles.  Such a shame.  As a fan of the franchise I'm frankly gutted.

The so many DLC guns which add nothing of any importance, make no differnce to gameplay, and apears to be shameless profiteering.  I'm baffled as to how so many people are recommending this, it's really below par.

Just a quick edit to clarify something to those who think a 200m shot is some kind of achievment with a sniper rifle...  Standard military engagement training with a standard rifle is 300m, but can achieve acuracy up to 800m with marksman sights.  M16A2 and an M1 Garand can both be fired accurately up to 500m.  Engagement distances of rifles haven't changed much at all since WW1... Though modern 'sniping' is done mostly at closer ranges due to visibility (or lack thereof), for a game going by the name 'sniper elite' I really wanted to see the opportunity for shots at over 800m.  The all new amazing awesome open maps, however... fail to present such options.

3.5/10
voteText: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
This game is great in terms of a games that you can keep going back for more!. The Levals are quite long so it keeps you going for a while. Its more about sniping than gun fights with automatic rifles and is more challenging than V2. Also you chose what way you go, theres no certain path like in V2.

Although, there are a few things that Rebellion need to work on for their next game and that would be:
1. please put more levels in.
2.put more wepons in the game for the price we payed for the game.
3. allow costum change in campaign
4. customisation of all guns

but in all i think that this game was overall a pretty good game but needs further development

reviewText: Great game. Goes from the simple nice graphics blastathon of SEV2 to having to be more like a real sniper, I like the fact you have to move postition to stop becomming comprimised by staying in one place and blasting away like SEV2. Still has the awesome bullet cam, which I recommend to have on reduced mode, then only really satisfying shots go bullet cam. Has great graphics and game play, it's fun to replay levels to get better shots. A little short, took me 9 hrs in total but well worth the £19 I paid for it in a sale. reviewText:
This game is poor. Sniper Elite 2 was much better, but in all honesty that isn't saying much. The following reasons are why this game is terrible and should not be purchased, or redeemed for free as I have.

1. Broken movement mechanics: There is horrible mouse acceleration which cannot be adjusted and makes movement very difficutl.
2. Broken Shooting mechanics. I play on Sniper Elite mode as well as realist mode. Aiming over a targets head and compensating for bullet drop was not consistant. Slightly shooting over their head then compensating by a little made me shoot the target in the lower chest or pevlis on many occasions. Bullet mechanic are broken.
3. Beyond repetative. Increadable linear battlefield. Terrible AI. Increase in difficult turns up the speed of the AI aimbot.

The Positive: Xray vision on shooting people is a cool and enjoyable aspect. For about 30 minutes. And Since Sniper Elite 2 has the exact same Xray, set in the European Theater, with much less buddy mechanics. That is the game you should choose if you want to just destroy people with xray bullet cams.

I will try to suffer through a few hours of gameplay just to make this review more respectable.

reviewText:
Campaign
Very open spaced. Good story. On the hardest difficulty, first time playing, it will take under 8 hours with many re-attempts. Looks beautiful in game, AI is a little harder than V2. Kill cam is great, but repetitive animation in areas on the face.

Some problems encountered.
- Limited weapons...
- Repetitive animations..
- Short game play, if only playing main objectives.
- Invisible barriers exceeding over a graphical object. (very annoying when in cover trying to shoot)
- Not worth the price if there are weapon DLCs..

Mine main problem was If you buy SE3 from a store, not wanting to download the game like me, after installing two DVDs worth of game, you still have to download another 6Gb on steam!

The game personally feels unfinished, Unlocking another weapon half way through wasn't an enjoyment as I could only choose between four rifles, three semi-auto's, one rocket launcher and three pistols. Also with the DLCs out at the same time as the game, Rebellion IS being money greedy. Should of been made into the game and then left a month to implement the DLCs..

I would recommend the game for stealth/sniper lovers but for the price I would wait till Sniper Elite 3 is the Steam sales!

reviewText:
Much improved version of the previous Sniper Elite games.  With every iteration of the game they seem to make improvements.  However, the game can be a bit short if you play it on easier difficulty settings.  Ramp up the difficulty settings and attempt to play through the missions completely stealth and you'll see a much longer play through.

I LOVE LOVE LOVE that they added the full on co-op, play this with a friend and you won't be disappointed in the fun you'll have.  Using Steam to connect with friends and play co-op is a breeze! I had no disconnect issues, no lag, and no fuss with playing co-op unlike many titles where you can spend hours forwarding ports, etc.

If you are looking for some competitive play I really wouldn't recommend this title though. The regular VS multiplayer was uninspired and boring and I don't recommend it for that.  It quickly devolves into hiding behind cover and firing wildly at people when you see them; basically a big camping game.  It would have been nice for them to add some objectives to complete or some incentive to move about the map.

The graphics seem to be improved from the previous games.  The game runs extremely smoothly on my computer and loads lightening quick.  I haven't had any issues with game crashing or major bugs.  One issue is sometimes invisible" cover will block your shot if you try to fire too closely to it resulting in a shot that should have hit
recommended: but I still highly recommend this game if you enjoy sniping games and co-op!"

reviewText: Yeah, third person with gory sniping (you get a MRI scan for everyone you snipe showing exploing skulls and spleens). Basically it's a sneak around game, be patient, be silent. The game gives the idea of Far Cry freedom, but is pretty much on rails to be honest. Flaky in 3D, although ok to play with. Have completed the first mission in three sittings (I don't play much these days), and persuaded me to drop 25 quid on the season pass, for all the DLC - Hitler / Churchill missions and some guns to improve your loadout. LIttle clumsy in play style, Lara Croft did it better, but nice little shooter that's isn't in your face, and rewards if not demands... patience and a little planning. Next sale, get it, it's good!

reviewText:
I recommend this game to anyone who likes stealth gameplay and/or third person action.  I found it highly enjoyable and well worth the price, a big improvement over the first and second titles.

The good:

The game looks great.  Polished visuals throughout.
A wide range of difficulty options and optional objectives lets you make the game as hard as you like.
More than long enough, especially with the DLC.
Open-ish gameplay with optional objectives, collectibles, and a little bit of upgrading and customization.
Historically accurate (mostly) settings and hardware.
A gruesome bullet cam which can be turned up, down, or off in frequency and grotesque-ness.


The bad:

Barely any story, and not much in the way of good storytelling.
A stealth system which is tempting to exploit, running away from the place from which you last shot to get stealthed
date: then going right back to shoot again.\nDespite a wide range of weapons, there is a clear winner in each category (primary, secondary, sidearm), regardless of playstyle.  For example, there's no reason to use any of the non-suppressed sidearms.

I'm not the kind of patient player, i'm head out first in the action but i really enjoyed this game and it is my favourite for PC.\nThe only bad experience with this game is the fact that i've encountered a few cheating players on multiplayer servers, wallhaking to be more specific. Great value for money if you get it on %sale.

reviewText: This is the only game that I've ever played in the Sniper Elite Series. I decided to buy it on sale and always had been curious about a sniping game. The graphics are really good especially on daylight: sunlight is amazing, the shadows on tents are awesome, the skies are really good and the textures seem very detailed. Playing at night is just ok. The gameplay is good: staying in cover, shooting, aiming and everything works fine but I find the mechanics a little annoying and unrealistic. It can be annoying because there are some parts when you can't find a device to mask your shots so you can't basically use your sniper if you want a stealth approach (like I do) and the game is unrealistic because 1 man can take over a camp full of infantry, tanks and explosives (playing stealthy can be believable but all guns blazing is ridiculous). The game has 8 main missions that I finished in about 11 hours on marksman difficulty. The story isn't engaging at all but serves its purpose for an entertaining infiltration of nazi forces on Afrika. If you like games similar to Splinter Cell, Rainbow Six and Call of Duty I recommend it. 7.5/10
voteText: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
This game is fun for several reasons.

First of all, don't expect a realistic simulation of BEING a sniper. The realism is mainly present in the shooting physics - it doesn't really simulate how snipers actually operate because that probably wouldn't be as fun as what this game provides.

The best feature, in my opinion, is the consistently fun and non-frustrating gameplay, which persists despite difficult-to-master mechanics. This comes from the nice save system and forgiving stealth mechanics. Being able to quick-save really changes the fun of this game, in my opinion. Instead of what happens in other stealth games where you make a mistake, everyone gets alerted, then you have to open up a menu, sit through a long loading screen, and start at the beginning of the level, you get an quick-save button which saves while you continue playing, so you can always save before you try something risky and just focus on the fun sniping mechanics and visuals. Also, one of the other problems that can happen in a lot of stealth games is that it's hard to keep track of your surroundings, so somebody might see you but you won't realize it until it's too late. This game provides subtle audio-cues and less subtle visual cues to let you know when you are about to be spotted.

You might think that the aforementioned features make the game too easy or too simple, but I think it just lets you focus on what this game does best - being stealthy and sniping people.

If you really like sniping in other FPS games (the feel of precision and power), you'll definitely like this game because it focuses on that one aspect of FPS. If you're concerned about having to spend more time sneaking around than shooting, you're in luck because even though you might alert everyone and have them go aggressive, you can still clear levels just by running and gunning and shooting everyone in sight.

So, overall, I think this game is pretty fun.
